alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll; Howard (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 7:27PM EDT until September 08 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Carroll County in north central Maryland... Central Howard County in central Maryland... Southwestern Baltimore County in northern Maryland... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 727 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Columbia, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Pikesville, Historic Ellicott City, Ellicott City, Woodlawn, Randallstown, Owings Mills, Eldersburg, Milford Mill, Lochearn, Sykesville, Oakland, Garrison, Fulton, Highland, Clarksville, Henryton, West Friendship, Dayton, and Woodstock. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
